statement.p: What is the area of this floor in square feet?

solution.p: This floor area consists of a rectangular area (on the left) and a triangular area (on the right). First measurements should all be converted to the same unit.
Top edge: \displaystyle{13}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{5}\ \text{ in}={161}\ \text{ in}
Left edge: \displaystyle{6}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{9}\ \text{ in}={81}\ \text{ in}
Bottom edge: \displaystyle{8}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{1}\ \text{ in}={97}\ \text{ in}
We do not need the length of the right edge (angled).
The area of the rectangle is \displaystyle{\left({81}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({97}\ \text{ in}\right)}={7857}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

The triangles top edge has length \displaystyle{\left({161}\ \text{ in}\right)}-{\left({97}\ \text{ in}\right)}={64}\ \text{ in}. The left edge is 81 in. Thus the area of the triangle is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left({81}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({64}\ \text{ in}\right)}={2592}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

Thus the total area is \displaystyle{7857}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}+{2592}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}={10449}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}. Converting this to square feet it becomes \displaystyle{10449}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}\right)}^{{2}}=\frac{{10449}}{{144}}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}={72.5625}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}\approx{73}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}.
